Founder of Dunedin band The Chills, Martin Phillipps, dies unexpectedly https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/Founder-of-dunedin-band-the-chills-martin-phillipps-dies-unexpectedly/3BGAAJ7HCREULPLJO3MQOSJJBE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/Founder-of-dunedin-band-the-chills-martin-phillipps-dies-unexpectedly/3BGAAJ7HCREULPLJO3MQOSJJBE/ The Chills were formed in Dunedin in 1980 by Martin Phillipps. Sun, 28 Jul 2024 07:47:09 +0000 The Chills founder Martin Phillipps has died aged 61. Photo / Frans Schellekens/Redferns.
SH1 Putāruru has reopened after two-vehicle crash with reports of serious injuries closed the highway earlier https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/sh1-putaruru-close-following-serious-two-vehicle-crash-with-reports-of-serious-injuries/QD24XTTQZRAVPDD5QMAE46EAIU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/sh1-putaruru-close-following-serious-two-vehicle-crash-with-reports-of-serious-injuries/QD24XTTQZRAVPDD5QMAE46EAIU/There are believed to be serious injuries, police say. Sun, 28 Jul 2024 07:07:53 +0000 Police said the highway was closed after a crash. Photo / NZME
Mother’s forehead left with boot imprint after attack by partner Kiro Fortes https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/woman-left-with-boot-imprint-on-forehead-after-partner-kiro-fortes-attacked-her/2VM56TA3RJDDJKIREL4TO72GRE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/woman-left-with-boot-imprint-on-forehead-after-partner-kiro-fortes-attacked-her/2VM56TA3RJDDJKIREL4TO72GRE/ Belinda FeekKiro Fortes strangled woman before throwing her to the ground and stomping on her. Sun, 28 Jul 2024 06:00:00 +0000 Kiro Fortes avoided a jail sentence for stomping on his partner's head and leaving an imprint in August last year. Photo / 123rf
Green Party party drags out process to evict now independent MP Darleen Tana – Thomas Coughlan https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/green-party-party-drags-out-process-to-evict-now-independent-mp-darleen-tana-thomas-coughlan/MLUBPNO6WZE2JEZDHSLNG4WYEQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/green-party-party-drags-out-process-to-evict-now-independent-mp-darleen-tana-thomas-coughlan/MLUBPNO6WZE2JEZDHSLNG4WYEQ/ Thomas CoughlanOPINION: Darleen Tana's demise looks inevitable, but the Greens are taking their time. Sun, 28 Jul 2024 04:22:25 +0000 Green Party MPs Teanau Tuiono (left), co-leader Chlöe Swarbrick (centre) and Ricardo Menendez March (right) speak after beginning the process to boot Darleen Tana from Parliament. Photo / Joe Allison
Taupō tsunami: What scientists have discovered about rare 2022 event https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/taupo-tsunami-what-scientists-have-discovered-about-rare-2022-event/P2UTIURCNJES5JC5M6LGI66H7A/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/taupo-tsunami-what-scientists-have-discovered-about-rare-2022-event/P2UTIURCNJES5JC5M6LGI66H7A/ Jamie MortonThe 2022 midnight tsunami was one of NZ's strangest natural events. How did it happen? Sun, 28 Jul 2024 04:00:00 +0000 Among 1700-odd earthquake events linked to a 13-month bout of unrest at Taupo volcano was a magnitude 5.6 event that struck just before midnight on November 30, 2022 – jolting residents awake and sending a small surge of water towards the shore that damaged boats at Four Mile Bay. Photo / Dan Hutchinson
Violence at Wairoa weekend rugby game leaves people with injuries https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/violence-at-wairoa-weekend-rugby-game-leaves-people-with-injuries/NU3G6CFVKVHRJMIAKOQUCWR7IY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/violence-at-wairoa-weekend-rugby-game-leaves-people-with-injuries/NU3G6CFVKVHRJMIAKOQUCWR7IY/ Police say no firearms were used in disorder at rugby match. Weather: Orange heavy rain warnings, wind watches in place for South Island https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/orange-heavy-rain-warnings-wind-watches-in-place-for-south-island/EQXIPCTPDVCPXKPXR3GKTWT3SU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/orange-heavy-rain-warnings-wind-watches-in-place-for-south-island/EQXIPCTPDVCPXKPXR3GKTWT3SU/ A complex trough crossing the South Island on Monday is set to bring severe weather. Photo / MetService
